Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frankies09
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 3 night stay at this hotel and before our trip we were a bit worried having read the trip advisor reviews. However, we would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again. *Yes, be aware that the hotel is in an area of development, but most of Dubai is! *There is an access road now from the main road to the hotel and most taxi drivers are aware of this (the access road is also sign posted). *There were always taxis on hand to take you where you needed to go. (As mentioned in previous reviews most of the taxi drivers are not keen to take you to or from the Dubai Mall - however there is finished pavements and pedestrian crossings so that you can safely make your way there and back and will only take 5 to 10 minutes) *The hotel staff were all very pleasant. *The rooms were clean, well presented and comfortable. *The sun deck was good, although the pool was a little small and the outside bar wasn't open (but staff were always on hand to take drink and food orders). There is a slight bit of noise from the roads nearby but not enought to stop you relaxing and enjoying the sun. *The gym was excellent. *The breakfast was lovely, and the meals we had by the pool were nice, but we didn't eat in the restaurant so can't comment on that. This hotel is not a luxury 5 star hotel like you will find on Jumeriah Beach, but it is a lovely hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: cyrils31
Reviews.Content: we had a weekend stay in Radisson Blu Dubai Downtown - its been perfect stay. Nice staff, friendly, no hassle with checkin and checkout. Its been nice food for the breakfast - not too much to choose from but very good still. We specifically enjoyed the bar on terrace - good view and good service. The only weak thing we got to point out - coz of construction works in Dubai, a way from Dubai Mall to the hotel takes literally 3 minutes by taxi - and taxi drivers hate getting that tiny pay-per-trip - so they charge taxi's minimum which is some 10 dirhams (3 bux) - but same time you cannot walk by feet this distance because there is no pedastrian road for these 3 minutes drive/walk. So you MUST take a cab. An opposite way - from the hotel to dubai mall for example - takes some 15 minutes (by car_ becauase again, coz of the construction works, you cannot drive directly. Hotel provides shuttles for free, every 30 mins, so it was not a big deal. VERY NICE CITY, VERY GOOD HOTEL. We will stay there again this year i hope. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Arabian adventure”
Reviews.Author: Marie S
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu Downtown was booked by my friend who I was travelling with, after booking I looked at all the reviews and must say, I was rather worried. From taxi's not being able to locate the hotel, the unmade roads, unfinished hotel, to criticism of the shuttle service. I have just returned from a four night break and there is access off the main road, our room was very clean and comfy. Breakfast was more than adequate. Shuttle service was prompt. Staff were very pleasant and more than helpful. Dubai mail is walking distance, if you miss the shuttle the taxi fare at 20 dirhams will not break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “middle of a building site”
Reviews.Author: nottsinternational
Reviews.Content: I wouldn’t recommend the Radisson Blue Downtown. Although the rooms were perfectly adequate (no frills) and clean the hotel is located in the middle of building site and it’s therefore not easy to walk to anywhere nearby. There is only one buffet style restaurant in the hotel and the breakfast, while again adequate, is nothing to shout home about. This is a basic hotel and fine for a short business stay (free internet) but not ideally for a lesire visit to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “A Convenient Business/Shopping Stopover hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: McGinlayduzitagain
Reviews.Content: It's in the middle of a building site but this hotel provides a cost effective solution to your business needs. We stayed for two days after an RCL emirates cruise for retail therapy and not the beach. The no-frills hotel is an easy 10 minute stroll from Dubai Mall. It has spectacular views across to the Burj Al Khalifa. The bedrooms are comfortable and business friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss.”
Reviews.Author: hoxtonbabe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights following a 5 night stay at a different hotel. I knew the area was a bit akward but as it was towards the end of my trip I knew I would manage. As others have mentioned it is in an akward position, Dubai mall is a 10minute walk along the highway which we did one day but would not like to do the journey at night or if you have lots of shopping. The hotel has a shuttle bus which is fine but goodness knows what will happen if there are more than 10 people wanting to use the bus. My issue is coming back. Taxi drivers are not keen on doing this very short trip from dubai mall and made it well known they were not pleased, if you have had a long day shopping of if in the height of summer walking back is not an option, so you either have to be totally reliant on the shuttle bus or be prepared to walk. I did not have any meals at the hotel so can not comment, the pool was freezing which is a shame as the hotel I stayed in previous had a lovely heated pool, the room was clean and of an ok size. The disappointing part was the floor I was put on, I was on the 24th floor, I can only assume they use this floor as overspill rooms as the common area is disgraceful. The carpet is tatty remnants and not the same as on the other floors, dangerous exposed carpet grips, dirty internal atrium windows. I am a Carlson member so was really disappointed with this and can only assume it was because I booked the room on the radisson sale rate which is a major bug bear of mine as they should not offer the rate if they treat the guest as second class. The rooms on this floor should not be let out due to the state of the common area, with that said though as mentioned the room itself is ok. I needed a rollaway bed which was actually on my booking notes, it took 3 hours to come and this was first requested at 7pm when my toddler wanted to sleep. I got a very low rate for the time of year, so didn't feel too bad about things however had I paid more or the non sale rate I would have been very very disappointed in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel, not bad... Location, BAD!”
Reviews.Author: Tygerlily20
Reviews.Content: I had a preliminary city tour upon arrival even before it officially started. My taxi driver could not find the hotel entrance from the main road and we kept on driving in circles, completing several merry-go-rounds until the taxi driver himself got frustrated (despite attempts in getting instructions from the hotel over the phone - and yes, i had to swallow the roaming bills). It was easily close to 1-1.5 hours journey from the airport altogether. In the end I was fetched by the hotel's limousine from Dubai Mall. Seems that they got this a lot but I still don't see any easy road signs that may help. On the positive side, the hotel room has a fantastic view over the Burj Dubai and generous spread of breakfast. Offers free shuttle the mall, which is another plus (though we were not picked up on the way back although we waited at the said spot).

Reviews.Title: “very bad location”
Reviews.Author: samerzawaideh
Reviews.Content: I went to Dubai Nov 28th, 2011 to attend an orthodontic meeting, and had the unfortunate luck of having my sponsoring company book me 2 nights in this hotel. When I saw the pictures on the website I was looking forwards to it. It is a big let down. It is in a construction area (what is to be the business bay) and is very close to the highway...although it is close to the Dubai Mall you can not just walk there. You have to take the hotel shuttle or the taxi. Also not easy to get a taxi from the hotel. Once I had to wait 15 minutes to get a taxi. We took the shuttle one day and had to keep our noses closed due to the bad smell in the shuttle. It is 10 AED to go by taxi from Dubai Mall to the hotel but taxi drivers start expressing discontent when they know they are going to that hotel since they will have to take a big detour after exiting the hotel since as I said it is in an area under construction. Our room was not that great. Electricity in my room went out 3 times during our stay. The furniture and the wall point is chipped. There were no bath robes. I called and asked for it and they only brought us one (I was staying with my wife!). Also they only provide one bottle of water for free, although again we were 2 persons staying there!!! I really could not wait to leave the hotel. Before I checked in the hotel I stayed 2 nights in Crown Plaza Festival city...that was a GREAT hotel, and a non smoking facility. Beautifully decorated rooms, excellent amenities, evening turn down service...

Reviews.Title: “what a letdown”
Reviews.Author: markw1941
Reviews.Content: Just returned from dubai five day stay at end of cruise so staight to the point. The hotel is in the middle of a construction site and access is extremely difficult even a taxi lost its way, By all accounts work has stopped on many of the buildings indefinately so be prepared, Yes there is a daily shuttle but would you believe it its a NINE seater we had over a HUNDRED guests in the hotel so if you do the sums mornings free shuttles were Chaotic with many a raised voice angrily expalining to the management how to organize this. We vacated our room at 09.30 returned at 05.00pm and the room was still not cleaned. When we complained about the shuttle and room service we were told too many visitors in the hotel and they could't cope.A poor excuse for a so called 4 star Radisson. We were on half board but dont bother buffet was cold and quality very poor. This hotel opened new in May and has along way to go to get anywhere near 4star standards. No Lounges in the hotel and the reception/lobby has only six chairs altogether a very dissaponting accomadation for such a vibrant city,

Reviews.Title: “What A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: flitemax
Reviews.Content: My brother booked us a twin room about a week ahead of our arrival in Dubai.  The reviews online were generally positive and he thought Radisson was of a certain minimum standard etc. but boy was he WRONG!  Where do I start? The location at this time is terrible due to unfinished roads nearby.  Getting here from downtown is quick.  However, getting to downtown you need to take a ring road and make a huge detour, taking 30 minutes . The reception staff talk to you when the feel like it. They dont respond to questions or even have eye contact.   The interiors and finishes are mediocre.  The pretentious white marble in the ground floor is stained.  The room itself seemed OK at first. After my first shower I was shocked to spot huge stains and long hairs on the supposedly fresh  towel.  Express ironing service requested and they said thry could give us back two shirts and two pants wi thing 20 minutes.  40 minutes  later I called reception to enquire since we were in a hurry  The receptionist said there is already an ironing  board in the room amd that she couldnt understand why we couldnt do it ourselves!!!  How rude.  The beds and pillows are shear orthopedic terror.  I'm in my early 30s and an athlete. The next morning I woke up with a stiff back due to the rock hard pillows amd matress.  As if the above is not enough, the room service is horrible.  We ordered lasagna and it arrived cold.  We called to complain and they pledged to replace it.  15 minutes later they sent another - cold lasagna! Gym facilities: After steam room one looks forward to a warm shower. That was too much to ask! Only ice cold water was available im the showers.  Avoid this hotel if you are expecting quality from a 4 star hotel!  And I believe this hotel considers itself a five star facility.  In fairness, some things were OK. For instance requested power adapter was sent within minutes.  However mediocrity or disappointment were the norm here.  We looked foward to one thing only - checking out.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: captainfool
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights for gitex 2011 and related business. I have been to UAE on and off since 2001. For business trips take your chance to stay here now is my advice, you wont be disappointed. The hotel is new and operating way before the new 'financial' area is fully developed. The staff, service and location are great IMHO. I think that by now (15 Oct 2011) the access road is very likely open, but I consider myself lucky to have had the chance to ride through the desert and Dubai building project to get to the hotel .... all great fun when taken in the right spirit and for what it is .... a great city being built before your eyes. Anyway, access from the service roads from 'Financial' road is probably done now, which is only a very short distance from Dubai Mall anyway. What has triggered me to write this review is the exceptional staff and 'can do' attitude though. I attended gitex 2011 and also took a trip to Abu Dhabi for one day. All was very easily done and helped tremendously by the 'can do' attitude of the hotel staff, courtesy bus and hotel car service. The late checkout was the icing on the cake. Oh, and did I mention that I paid for all my nights with loyalty points? Sweet. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “A FANTASTIC STAY FROM START TO FINISH”
Reviews.Author: IAN/PLYMOUTH
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a weeks stay in Dubai and have to say that we found a gem in this hotel. Staff, service (always with a smile) and food and beverage were first class. Free internet, free shuttle to the mall and beach, big pool area, great bar, PERFECT. I know there were issues regarding the new road not being connected but now it is the closest hotel to Dubai Mall with free shuttle on the hour. Yes there is construction work going on in the area, that is Dubai, get used to it but it did not impact our stay in any way at all. Look out of most hotels in Dubai and you will see a crane and building work, this is a city growing at an incredible pace. The buzz of the city was awesome as usual and for holiday makers who want choices of things to do and if on a budget, this location is perfect. One of the best breakfast options in Dubai

Reviews.Title: “Full of flaws”
Reviews.Author: chriscrossNorway
Reviews.Content: Read italgrecolon's review further down. It covers the basic critics of this hotel. Let me just repeat some of them and add a few extra. > location is in the middle of nowhere, in one corner of a building site and highways on two sides. The detours make it impossible for taxi drivers to find. No info on the website. > rooms: normal sized rooms, panoramic windows. Limited closet space. Short bath tubs. Rooms are not sound-proof, we were disturbed by people walking in the corridor. Free wifi, but low signals in our room. Ventilation in the bathroom was almost non-existent. > service/food: ordered room service once, lasagne. Was served almost cold, and no garlic bread as mentioned in the menu. We complained. To be on the safe side the new lasagnas came over cooked. Asked the reception to prebook a taxi to the airport. We were told several times that it was ok and on its way. No car showed up. Starting to lack time, we insisted that the hotel sorted this out as we were literally stucked in the desert and the construction site. No such help was given. We were saved by other guests arriving with a taxi. As noticed by others, the hotel is pretty newly opened. One should show some patience, but this hotel has a very long way to go. If you plan to make this your hotel for your Dubai holiday I recommend you to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff.. Saved the day!”
Reviews.Author: bpbindaas
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the newly opened downtown Radisson blu during my 2 day trip in June. The hotel is right in the Dubai downtown, a couple of kilometres from the Dubai mall. However, it is located just off the main highway. It is a nightmare if you are driving to the hotel as the detour will take you miles round and round the downtown. Also, there are no properly marked signs (although they erected one the day I arrived) to help you reach there. The whole place leading to the hotel resembles a construction site adding to the confusion. As this is a new property, most of the cabbies are not sure of the exact route. A drop from the airport which should have costed 50 AED costed me 100 as none of us were sure how to reach the hotel. Hence, it makes sense to call up the hotel beforehand to enquire about the directions. However, the hotel itself is very fresh and nice. The staff are very well trained and are eager to help you and make your stay nice. There is a swimming pool and a gym, but I did not get the time to use them. The rooms are nice and practical- something the Radisson Blu chain stands for. They do provide a free shuttle to and from the nearest metro stations and to the Dubai Mall. It is available on a 15 min notice. Overall a nice hotel- but the location and the roads leading to the hotel need special care.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful..”
Reviews.Author: ddddd77
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Radisson Blu Hotel Dubai Downtown in the middle of May. This brand new hotel is at a very convenient location - within 10 minutes walking distance to the Dubai Mall - a great place for a shopping spree! We stayed at a business class room which was spacious and very nicely furnished. The staff was very friendly. We loved to have drinks at the terrace of their bar and watch the sunset. Great service - great location! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Warning : This hotel is far from ready & lacks service”
Reviews.Author: ItalGrecoLon
Reviews.Content: This is a new property, booked directly on Radisson.com. It opened 3 days before my arrival. Billed as 1km away from Dubai Mall/Burj Khalifa. Since it was a new property, I downloaded the map displayed on their website. Arrived at Dubai airport, jumped in a taxi and we drove around for an eternity - the driver could not find the hotel. He called several times for directions and we appeared to be driving through non existent roads, but service roads through building sites. Out of frustration, we asked the taxi driver to let us out near a metro station and the hotel told us they would send a driver to collect us. The driver turned up around 10 minutes later. We were impressed by the hotel for doing this. This lasted momentarily. It was no wonder the taxi driver could not locate the hotel, it is in the middle of a building site with no infrastructure in terms of a road. Unless you knew the hotel was there, you would never find it. In short - the hotel has opened ahead of time, with no main road access. The hotel is glass and steel, minimalistic. Apart from myself/partner, there appeared to be around 10 other guests that we saw - Mostly Russian. The breakfast buffet was poor. Granted, with so few guests, wastage needs to be taken into account, but with more staff than guests, the sensible thing to do would be replenish little but often. This was not the case. A European Head Chef, clearly visible, who has not taught the ' egg station ' how to fry eggs. not count, since 2 fried eggs over easy are in fact 1 egg and crisp frisby's. I understand there are teething problems when a new hotel opens, but c'mon, a European Head Chef can oversee a handful of guests and the staff to offer a better quality experience. Rooms are nice, fresh and as usual with the Radisson group, internet access is free. The bathroom was foolishly finished with a tub and a shower attached to the taps. Zero water pressure. The hotel as a whole, is glass and steel and lacks any warmth. The pool area is large, but simply concrete surrounds. The hotel has views over the entire area, which is simply a building site. Food at the hotel, a cafe to speak of, was expensive. 55 dhs for a panini is ridiculous. The feeling is of imprisonment. The mall is 1km away, but there is no read access. The hotel, savvy to this fact, provides a shuttle service to the mall. ' As and when Guests need it '. Not so. It also seats 7 people. I needed to visit a friend in Satwa, I asked the reception if I could take the shuttle to the mall where I would pick up a taxi. They assured me the hotel limousine was ' slightly ' more expensive than a taxi. I am very familiar with Dubai and ' slightly ' was in fact triple, the meter starts at 8.5dhs before you leave the complex, a taxi starts at 3dhs. My taxi ride was 60dhs. From Dubai Mall, the ride is actually 11dhs. When I returned to the mall, I called the hotel for a shuttle pick up and was told I would need to wait one hour, the shuttle driver had a previous appointment taking a guest to ' The Address '. My understanding was the shuttle only takes guests to and from the Mall. I took a local taxi and directed him through the building site, which due to the navigation adds mileage and so you pay accordingly, if the hotel opened when the road was complete the taxi fare would be a few dirhams. When I arrived back at the hotel, since it's new, Radisson have clearly sent some European employees to oversee it's opening. I approached Reception and detailed the limousine experience. I know hotel limousine's are more expensive, but was assured slightly more expensive .... in my mind, that does not mean triple. Since you cannot call a taxi, you are reliant upon them. The money was not the question, being lied to by a 5 star hotel - clearly integrity isues. I was told the shuttle had no fixed time and Guests would be taken and picked up as their needs required. I explained this was clearly not the case. The response was apologies and ' What can we do to make it right ?' You tell me. Am I to suggest a complimentary stay, a refund of the limousine fare, an upgrade for my next stay .... not forthcoming and as a guest, not for me to suggest. Whilst I was relaying my grief, another guest, female, was at the reception having gone through the same experience as I, only the local taxi she took, dumped her on the roadside, refusing to drive any further through the building site. As a business traveller, she was late to all her meetings. I returned to my room, only to find that in the 4 hours since I had left, despite leaving the ' Please Clean my room ' card on the door, my room had not been serviced. I returned to reception and at this time, the European employee I had met, was now speaking to the Hotel Manager and relaying my experience. The Manager did not speak to me. I was staying on a discounted rate. It was a rate offered by Radisson, that does not mean I am not a Guest regardless of what I paid. That evening, we climbed over the temporary wall and walked through the dust to the main road and onto the mall. There was no way we were going to wait an eternity for the ' shuttle available as and when a guest needs it ' to take us there. I was told that they have no control over roads being built. Granted. But you cannot open a hotel with no infrastructure, access to the hotel is reliant upon a road being completed. Having checked the website again, there is still no mention that the property has no main road access. We checked out early. Once the public road into the hotel opens, there is no question, the location will be great. My experience lacked integrity, a lack of being able to win back a guest and with so many hotel rooms in Dubai now, needs to up it's game a great deal. I am a keen Radisson guest, and will continue to be, but this property lacks in every respect. Photos attached.

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Blu Hotel Dubai Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: PO Box 123141, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
